column4: Hey, I'm having this error whenever I try to launch Synaptic: "another package manager like apt-get is already running .... "
eventhough I don't have them running ./.. what should I do ?
Hey, I'm having this error whenever I try to launch Synaptic: "another package manager like apt-get is already running .... "
you can use the fuser command to discover who is using
how do I use that ?
type man fuser - complete instructions will appear as if magic :)
sounds like something is running away - use top to see
naa - use kill or killall if you cannot find it in a terminal
all different compressions
this is not a complete answer but prolly worth you looking at: http://www.pathname.com/fhs/
it is nothing to use many filemanagers at the same time.  try gnome-commander for instance
but what's the difference? on what basis a file manager is concidered good ?
seriously, the only criteria is do you like it.
ummm. It's okay then/.
some folks prefer naut, some konqueror, some mc
so it's the same argument as what's better? Gnome or KDE..
yes but even more pointless
hehe. Thanks for the help.
I hail you for that.
but as you said .. what's the point ?
